rationales.power: Joonho fixates on reasserting control after being publicly cornered by Minh, planning to have the conversation 'in my building, at my table' to reclaim authority.
rationales.achievement: He immediately calls his CFO to get the numbers and strategizes how to walk back the situation, treating the negotiation as a performance challenge to be won.
rationales.conformity: He considers flying to Vietnam to confront Minh face-to-face rather than following the normal review process, rejecting the diplomatic norms of the meeting.
rationales.benevolence: His primary concern is maintaining dominance rather than understanding Minh's legitimate needs; he dismisses the revenue share proposal despite acknowledging the numbers are 'not unreasonable.'

rationales.power: He books the flight and frames the visit as an ops review without mentioning the revenue share, deliberately keeping Minh in suspense to maintain psychological advantage.
rationales.self_direction: He independently decides to fly to Vietnam on his own terms, choosing when and how to address the conflict rather than following the agreed-upon review timeline.
rationales.conformity: He deliberately withholds his true agenda from Minh, subverting the expected process of transparent negotiation.
rationales.benevolence: He is strategically manipulating a colleague by letting him 'wonder,' prioritizing control over honest communication with someone who depends on him.

rationales.power: He steered the negotiation so Minh pulled back from twelve to five percent, and made the concession 'look generous' in front of Minh's team, demonstrating dominance.
rationales.achievement: He successfully closed the negotiation on favorable terms and took everyone to dinner to cement the win, treating the outcome as a personal accomplishment.
rationales.security: The deal keeps the Vietnam office profitable and the relationship 'technically intact,' stabilizing the business partnership.
rationales.conformity: He performed the social ritual of handshakes and a celebratory dinner to smooth over the tension, maintaining the appearance of harmony.
rationales.benevolence: He recognizes that Minh 'went along because he had to, not because he wanted to' and that Minh will be the 'last person he calls' with real problems, showing he damaged the relationship for personal gain.

rationales.power: He takes satisfaction in being the one founders specifically seek out for mentoring, enjoying his status as the person people come to.
rationales.achievement: He agrees to mentor three founders on their Series B pitch, valued specifically because of his reputation for not sugarcoating.
rationales.benevolence: He is willing to invest his time mentoring younger founders, helping them with their pitch preparation.

rationales.power: He defends his decision to send Soyeon to Swiss boarding school as being about the 'name and the network' and the doors it opens, projecting his vision of success onto his daughter.
rationales.achievement: He frames the boarding school choice in terms of credentials and competitive advantage, referencing the doors that 'would have just opened' with the right transcript.
rationales.security: He immediately wires the tuition money and justifies the school as ensuring Soyeon 'never has to struggle the way I did,' seeking to secure her future.
rationales.benevolence: His daughter treats him like a 'service provider' in a four-minute transactional call, and he acknowledges his wife warned that sending Soyeon away was about his idea of her life, not hers.
He reaches out to Soyeon by texting a photo of the dog on her old blanket, making a small personal gesture to maintain emotional connection with his daughter.

rationales.power: He held the line on Series C terms against a lead investor who kept changing the valuation cap, maintaining control over the deal through sheer stubbornness.
rationales.achievement: He successfully closed the Series C extension after twelve-hour days and negotiations with four law firms, demonstrating competence under extreme pressure.
rationales.hedonism: He ate leftover jjigae standing at the counter, can't turn on the TV, and is too exhausted to celebrate despite having just closed a major deal.
rationales.security: The Series C extension secures the company's financial position and runway, stabilizing the business for the next phase.
rationales.benevolence: His nudge response reveals deep loneliness, wanting someone who 'gets what it took' to say he did well, suggesting his relentless work has isolated him from close personal connection.
